resources.string: Welcome to Citizen Observatory! By using this app, you can participate in the scientific process and help determine whether or not the Sun\'s size fluctuates over time. We aim to measure this by having scientists like you record the duration of eclipses from different locations along the path of the eclipse, which we can use alongside other measurements we know, such as the size of the Moon and the distance between the Earth and the Moon, to calculate the size of the Sun over periods of time. We\'ll send you notifications when eclipses are coming up, and you\'ll see some cool sights in space and be a researcher at the same time!
Eclipse coming up? Press the button to begin!

Press the two buttons below to record your data! You will be guided through the process. Be ready to record video before the eclipse begins. You can record your location before or after, as long as you remain in the same place.
Double check that your data is correct below, and press the send results button when you\'re ready to email it to our team. You did it! Thank you!

Enter your current latitude and longitude, as precisely as possible. A good way to do this is to open the Google Maps app (by pressing the button below), press and hold on the blue dot indicating your current location until a red pin pops up, and then look in the search bar at the top of the screen to find your coordinates. The first number is your latitude, and the second is longitude. Make sure that Google Maps has you in the right place! Copy your coordinates into the boxes below, and press the continue button.

Press the button below to open a video camera. Before the eclipse begins, begin taking a video, and make sure that the phone is pointed at the eclipse and recording when totality (when the Moon totally covers the Sun) begins. Keep the video running, and make sure that the phone is pointed at the eclipse and recording when totality ends. Where it points in between doesn\'t matter, but keep it running so that we can find the exact duration of totality later. When you\'ve finished recording, there will be a check mark in the top right corner of your screen. Press that, and it will bring you back to this screen! Press the continue button to finish.
